history.content:
152 is definitely not a prereq for 151. But 61C and EE16B definitely are, that is all the background you need.

FPGA labs are ~3-5 hrs per week. The first few labs are individual, but the last couple labs and the project are done in partner pairs.

--------------------

Expect to spend about 15-30+ hours on 151 project for the last few weeks of the semester.

--------------------

EE105 is not a prereq. Anytime I've asked about a 105 related topic, I was told it was outside the scope of this class.

--------------------

Expect to spend about 30+ hours on 151 project for the last few weeks of the semester.

FPGA labs are ~3-5 hrs per week. The first few labs are individual, but the last couple labs and the project are done in partner pairs.

--------------------

Expect to spend about 30+ hours on 151 project for the last few weeks of the semester.

--------------------

EE105 is a prereq for the first half of the course. [I was told by a GSI of this class]

152 is definitely not a prereq for 151. But 61C and EE16B definitely are, that is all the background you need.

children.subject: (OP here) 30+ hours per week or 30+ hours in total for the project?

history.content:
I'm thinking of taking EE/CS 151 and CS 168 next semester in the fall, but i had a couple of questions for anyone who's currently in it or who has taken it at any point.

What prereqs should I take? I've completed CS61A/B/C and the EE16 series, and I was hoping 61C would be enough background information to take it, but is it recommended to take CS152 first?

Also, for anyone who's enrolled in the FPGA lab section, how much work are the labs/projects, and are partners allowed?

Thanks so much!
history.subject: EE/CS 151
